ratings.comment: I'd definitely recommend taking his class if you can. Not much menial work - most of the grade is based on major papers and presentations. He provides examples of exactly what he does (and doesn't) expect for each assignment Dr. K's an extremely smart guy with a great sense of humor. Lectures seem to fly by.  Easy B, a little tougher to get an A.

He provided clear explanations of the material and expectations for writing assignments. The class builds on itself from the early assignments all the way to the final technical report. He's a fair grader and gives clear feedback on how to improve as well.

A lot of learning how to fine tune your writing to fit specific formats (memo, technical report, etc.). Grade is based on major presentations and papers. Very time consuming for major assignments, but there aren't many time consuming minor assignments. Very fair grader. Other prof take points off for grammarspelling. Kundert focuses on content.

Dr. Kundert is a great professor. The class isn't hard but very time consuming. He gives great feedback and is a very fair grader. He tells you at the beginning of the semester if you don't put in the effort you won't do well. Dr. K provides several examples, both good and bad, for each of the assignment so you have a clear idea what to do.

Assignments were clearly laid out, granted every extension I asked for. Grading was fair, an A is definitely doable if you put in effort. Make sure you practice for his presentations, he'll notice. Not sure I would call him hot, but he's definitely young and in shape. tl;dr: He was a decent professor who graded fairly. Would recommend.
Just take a day to do all the major assignments and things should work out fine. As usual Kundert is pretty good.
Awesome professor. Just show him that you care about your grade.

Dr. Kundert is a great professor and a really nice guy! He makes class fun and interesting and most of all enjoyable. I look forward to class every week. He tells you exactly how he wants you to do your work and is a very generous grader. Great professor, great man.

He is a great teacher.  If you listen to what he says, and do exactly that, you will get an A.  I am not a good writer, but he outlines what your whole essay should be about and I did exactly that and ended with a 97 in the class.  Great class but too much work for 2 credits

I would recommend Dr. Kundert to anyone taking an EPD class. I heard he was a great professor from a friend, so I switched from another EPD teacher and it turned out to be the best decision my freshman year.  Go to class, put in the work, and you will be rewarded with the grade you want.  He also is very intelligent and is interesting in class.
Told you exactly what to do. DO it and you get an A, participation sucks though.

Awesome teacher. I feel like I learned a lot about organizing my papers. I admire his charisma and his intelligence. He presented some very interesting topics in class about coal and alternative energy. Loved him!

Kundert was a pretty good teacher. His grading practices were fair and addressed the main problem engineering students have with writing - organization. He understood that students could find the information, he just stressed organization and it is the biggest component of your paper grade. He only assigned 3 big papers with about 7 smaller ones.
Awesome professor. i had no interest in the class in the beginning of the semester but it quickly became my favorite. He really knows his stuff and grades very fairly.
Guy is really cool, grades nicely and makes sitting in class more than bearable. Great experience being in his class
Awesome teacher who not only has a whole lot of interesting things to share but is a really nice guy.  Deserves a whole lot more than EPD 155!
Great professor. No final, no exams. You need to do 2 big research papers, but still nothing challenging. Grades very fair as well. Highly recommend!!
Very god teacher!  Was hard but fair with grading of essays.  I will take more classes from him.
